Flavour Text: This elusive energy-rich planet was the desperate destination of the secret Lazax diaspora. Now, it is a technological nightmare.

Name: Abaddon
Flavour Text: A temperate planet whose low gravity allows for stunningly tall mountain ranges. Serves as a stop-over for trade troutes to the nearby Vorish Cluster.

Name: Abyz
Flavour Text: Its thick, complex atmosphere is inhospitable to most races, but Abyz is known for its seemingly endless natural reserves of rare minerals and precious metals.

Name: Accoen
Flavour Text: Populace lives on continent-sized fungal rafts that float atop a soupy, world-spanning ocean of useful bio-compounds. Popular research site for biologists.

Name: Acheron
Flavour Text: Once a dusty, dead world concealing a portal to Ixth. Now, a gravity rift has shattered the world, creating a labyrinth of strange energies and tumbling shards of rock.

Name: Alio Prima
Flavour Text: Wet planet covered in rivers, lakes, and small seas, but no oceans. Dry poles provide haven from constant floods. Numerous farms famous for luxury foodstuffs.

Name: Ang
Flavour Text: High rotational speed creates extremely energized magnetosphere. Orbital taps use this to energize starship fuels, and power labs developing new beam weapons.

Name: Arc Prime
Flavour Text: Below the thin surface atmosphere lie the continent-sized caverns of the Letnev. Rich in metals and energy, its vast fungus fields struggle to feed its population.

Name: Archon Ren
Flavour Text: Populated by small arboreal villages, this planet's only true urban center is the royal city of Kklaj. The Xxcha home world and home to the renowned library of Xuun.

Name: Archon Tau
Flavour Text: Ravaged by Sol and Letnev bombardments during the Twilight Wars. The Xxcha commit substantial resources to rebuilding its ecology and cleansing its toxic continents.

Name: Archon Vail
Flavour Text: A former Xxcha colony, its extremely low temperatures create exotic molecular compounds that give the world its famed violet hue. Orbital facilities use the compounds in high-energy stardrive research.

Name: Arcturus
Flavour Text: Cold and still, with a surface buried beneath kilometers of ice. A few smuggler bases dot the surface, but Sumerian Station circles the planet, making it a vital trading destination.

Name: Arinam
Flavour Text: Isolated planet poor in resources but rich in natural beauty. Boasts many exotic resorts frequented by the rich and famous of the galaxy.

Name: Arnor
Flavour Text: Lush, green world that is renowned for some of the most fertile soil in the galaxy. Dominated by endless fields and the processing facilities of large agricultural firms.

Name: Arretze
Flavour Text: Also called the "Moving Sand." The desert home of the Hacan Mowshir trade families and the great orbital trading ports of Haal, Shimax, and Dry Wind.

Name: Ashtroth
Flavour Text: Covered in boggy landmasses and shallow seas. Algal blooms provide rich biomass for processed foods, but create smelly (and often toxic) offgassing.

Name: Atlas
Flavour Text: Heavy grav world and former Sol colony famed for squat, strong inhabitants and strategic location. Visitors need support exoskeletons to move on the surface.

Name: Avar
Flavour Text: Lighter than its companion worlds, Avar is riddled with caverns. The majority of the Atharal Torus lives in the bustling aeries within, sheltered from the radiation bursts emanating from nearby Phorus.

Name: Ba'kal
Flavour Text: Dry, rocky deserts stretch from pole to pole. Shield cities protect against sandstorms while supplying nomadic harvester crawlers that mine the barrens for salt compounds.

Name: Bereg
Flavour Text: A frozen world that is inhospitable to most races. Indentured laborers risk attacks from arctic sharaks in the infamous lodinium mines.

Name: Cealdri
Flavour Text: Small cities huddle on the shores of the single ocean and avoid the arid continental interiors. Mentak ships hunt departing vessels carrying bespoke cybernetics.

Name: Centauri
Flavour Text: Venerable world with few resources but a rich history. Site of important treaties between several races during the Twilight Wars.

Name: Cormund
Flavour Text: A remote and sparsely settled Naaz-Rokha world destroyed during early entropic field tests. Now mining corporations harvest metals from the shattered core.

Name: Corneeq
Flavour Text: Former garden world that has subsequently enjoyed increased industrialization. Home to the esteemed Free Worlds Academy of Military Science and Research.

Name: Creuss
Flavour Text: Trapped between matter and void lies the realm of Creuss. Made of trapped light and radioactive gas, this realm hosts the most peculiar forms of life.

Name: Dal Bootha
Flavour Text: A populous planet whose resources have been severely depleted. Well-educated citizenry and many universities, but dependent on foreign imports.

Name: Darien
Flavour Text: Darien is the heart of the Brotherhood's realm. Here, within the great Monastery of Lucas, rests the Yin, the holy egg from which all the Brotherhood were made.

Name: Druaa
Flavour Text: Despite its oversized poles, one of the most beautiful of planets. Its flowered steppes, violet mountains, and glowing forests are famous across the galaxy.

Name: Elysium
Flavour Text: Larger than a thousand terrestrial planets, Elysium is an artifical shell-world built around the powerful singularity in its hollow heart. Its surface is covered in calm seas and cultivated plains.

Name: Everra
Flavour Text: Ancient world of red seas and bare rocks. Locals live in wondrous nano-carbon cities built by a mysterious ancient race, and mine nearby nebulae for rare gases.

Name: Fria
Flavour Text: Brutally cold ice world populated only by a few scattered mining camps. Despite its brutal climate, highly prized for its deposits of rare ores used in starship drives.

Name: Gral
Flavour Text: Backwater planet with modest resources and an unassuming populace. Most noted for the reliable and affordable vehicles produced in its factories.

Name: Hercant
Flavour Text: Also called the "Fire Sand." Seat of the Quieron, the Hacan council, and the Sword Fleet. Harbors the greatest of the famous Hacan moving cities.

Name: Hope's End
Rules Text: **Imperial Arms Vault**|Legendary - Hope's End|You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to place 1 mech from your reinforcements on any planet you control or draw 1 action card.|*Buried deep beneath the surface, the lost vaults contain a legion's worth of weapons.*
Flavour Text: Buried in the Ichal Nebula. The Lazax used the toxic wildlife and fierce aurora storms to train their troops. Even now, volatile weapon caches remain hidden beneath its sands.

Name: Ixth
Flavour Text: A dry, dead world of black volcanic mountains and molten seas of lava. The great necropolis of Aior Dol Gorgos on the Plateau Imperia is the only evidence of civilization.

Name: Jeol Ir
Flavour Text: Heavily industrialized world. Pollution has killed all life outside of dome cities, but twin suns provide constant power for factories and huge population.

Name: Jol
Flavour Text: Covered by cold oceans and a few inhospitable islands. The seat of the Headmaster, the Hylar ruler, who dwells in the deep underwater city of Wun-Escha.

Name: Jord
Flavour Text: Distinctly seasonal, with the greatest variety of climates and ecologies in the galaxy. The Federation of Sol rules the Jord humans from the great city of New Moscow.

Name: Kamdorn
Flavour Text: Also called the "Dream Sand." The least populated of the Hacan planets, but the center of the Hacan mythology and religion. The only known source of starflowers.

Name: Kraag
Flavour Text: A heavily irradiated world known only for its dust mines. Recenly, a massive "tomb" of dormant Titans was discovered in the southern hemisphere.

Name: Lazar
Flavour Text: The only inhabited world in a forgettable system. Few native resources and rudimentary, often underdeveloped, industries.

Name: Lirta IV
Flavour Text: Covered in vast swamps and fetid bogs. Home to rare biochemical compounds unique to its marshlands used in everything from exotic foods to biogenic drugs.

Name: Lisis
Flavour Text: Primordial world with primitive native life. Potential for terraforming led to the infamous genocide of Saar settlements by Sardakk N'orr, and ongoing conflict between them and Naalu forces.

Name: Lisis II
Flavour Text: The crystal caverns of Lisis II are the source of most of the Jorun colonists' water and foodstuffs. Notable for the great crescent-shaped valley of Gavar.

Name: Lodor
Flavour Text: Wealthy planet ruled by powerful biotech consortiums. Rumored to harbor hidden caches of outlawed bacterial weapons.

Name: Loki
Flavour Text: Cold and wracked with violent storms, Loki still hosts several Yssaril and human colonies, some of which have engaged in escalating shadow-conflicts.

Name: Lor
Flavour Text: Wreathed in vast seas of methane ice. Seafloor drilling platforms harvest rare crystals used in advanced computers and energy weapons.

Name: Maaluuk
Flavour Text: Mostly pungent marshland and mudplains. Original world of the Naalu race, which now enslaves the winged Miashan to work its great iron-extraction plants.

Name: Mallice
Rules Text: **Exterrix Headquarters**|Legendary - Mallice|You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to gain 2 trade goods or convert all of your commodities to trade goods.|*Founded by black market traders that fled through a wormhole and ended up in the space between.*
Flavour Text: Trapped in a space believed to be beyond our universe, a shimmering world of strange energies and disconcerting warping of physical laws sitting at the heart of a strategically vital wormhole nexus.

Name: Mecatol Rex
Flavour Text: Once a splendid place, now a sad devastated wasteland. Only the radiation-shielded Mecatol city, the seat of the powerful Galactic Council, remains habitable.

Name: Meer
Flavour Text: Hellish world immolated in the inferno of its nearby sun. Famed for the fiery majesty of its surface when viewed from the safety of its many orbital stations.

Name: Mehar Xull
Flavour Text: Unstable radiation belts create hazardous living conditions but facilitate research in electro-quantum propulsion technologies.

Name: Mellon
Flavour Text: Poor in natural resources, but rich in exotic plant and animal life. Protected as a planetary xenological garden and lifeform preserve.

Name: Mirage
Rules Text: **Mirage Flight Academy**|Legendary - Mirage|You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to place up to 2 fighters from your reinforcements in any system that contains 1 or more of your ships.|*Unsurprisingly, the triple-ace instructors emphasize strike-and-fade tactics and misdirection.*
Flavour Text: Exists on no known charts and appears deserted to those who stumble across it. However, secretive locals live in cloaked cities heavily defended by swarms of starfighters.

Name: Moll Primus
Flavour Text: In places lush and rich, in other a barren wasteland. This old Lazax penal colony has prospered under the rule of the governing Mentak Coalition.

Name: Mordai II
Flavour Text: Mined to its bones by the virulent Nekro, Mordai II is reinforced by the graviton energy beams that barely keep the world from collapsing in on itself.

Name: Muaat
Flavour Text: The fiery surface of Muaat is inhabitable to most races. It is home to the Gashlai, and only here can they live outside of their cumbersome ember suits.

Name: Naazir
Flavour Text: A small planet of high mountains and deep, narrow seas. Cities and vertical farms burrow into cliff faces, while orbital factories produce high tech consumer goods.

Name: Nar
Flavour Text: Covered by mild oceans and a small archipelago called The Reef by offworlders. The Circle of Regents makes its home in the underwater city-school of Nuun-Dascha.

Name: Nestphar
Flavour Text: The fungal world of Nestphar is home to the symbiotic Arborec. Nestphar's orbit is filled with Flaah spores that extend its Symphony.

Name: New Albion
Flavour Text: Rare atmospheric composition and biochemistry support lifeforms unlike any other in the galaxy.

Name: Perimeter
Flavour Text: Former garrison world with fond memories of the Lazax. Maintains formidable military with informal ties to the Winnu. Perpendicular rings make orbital navigation difficult.

Name: Primor
Rules Text: **The Atrament**|Legendary - Primor|You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to place up to 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.|*A clade of assassin-scholars has watched over Primor, pledged to its populace's survival.*
Flavour Text: Large temperate world. Site of several pitched battles during the Twilight Wars due to valuable osmium deposits and a well-educated populace.

Name: Quann
Flavour Text: Since the discovery of the Alpha Wormhole, this temperate planet with two continents and one large ocean has been a haven for traders and smugglers alike.

Name: Qucen'n
Flavour Text: After the Twilight Wars, existed for centuries as a near-utopia of scattered communal farms free from governmental interference.

Name: Quinarra
Flavour Text: Enormous and oceanless. Not only the largest planet supporting sentient life, but also the one with the least moisture. Home to the Sardakk N'orr hive cities.

Name: Ragh
Flavour Text: The capital colony of the Saar and the epicenter of the Saar religion. Also called "Ragh's Call" by the Saar.

Name: Rarron
Flavour Text: Large populous world with three distinctive moons renowned for its biomodification clinics and cyber boutiques.

Name: Resculon
Flavour Text: Poor in natural resources, but a nearby nexus of major trade routes has brought it increasing wealth as interstellar commerce has intensified.

Name: Retillion
Flavour Text: A mix of tundra, swamps, rivers, and dense forests. Home to the mysterious, chameleonic Yssaril, whose capital Wueca has eluded all attempts at cartography.

Name: Rigel I
Flavour Text: Hot, innermost world of the Rigel system. Cities and native life cluster inland from the heavily alkaline oceans.

Name: Rigel II
Flavour Text: Temperate world with expansive oceans. Covered in estates and resorts for the system's elite, with extensive fisheries that feed much of the rest of the system.

Name: Rigel III
Flavour Text: Outermost world of the Rigel system, and extensively settled despite cooler temperatures, Boasts a diverse range of industries and research institutions.

Name: Rokha
Flavour Text: Terraformed by comet-drops and Alliance biotech into a cool world with alpine forests and stormy seas. The city of Dormont Vault boasts the famous Exotic Energies Institute.

Name: Sakulag
Flavour Text: Jungle planet plagued by dangerous predators such as the arboreal razeden. Home to many exotic biochemicals and natural pharmaceuticals.

Name: Saudor
Flavour Text: Prosperous planet with large native population and substantial industry. Extreme axial tilt results in long day-night cycles that some races find uncomfortable.

Name: Sem-Lore
Flavour Text: Home to the Semanora, and heavily damaged in the Twilight Wars. Rusting warship hulks litter the rad-deserts, making it a war memorial and salvage site.

Name: Shalloq
Flavour Text: Covered with tundra, wetlands, and rainforest, much like its sister-planet Retillion. Home to Mojeb, the only major Yssaril city catalogued by off-worlders.

Name: Siig
Flavour Text: World covered in frozen, cesium-laced oceans. Archives buried deep beneath the surface use the cold to preserve relics and operate massive computers.

Name: Starpoint
Flavour Text: Large planet with eight small moons that supply a wide range of valuable resources. Acidic rains and toxic storms make it an unappealing destination for tourists.

Name: Tar'Mann
Flavour Text: Small isolated planet with small population and modest resource. Most famous for its delicious avinberries.

Name: Tequ'ran
Flavour Text: Desolate planet transformed into a weapons testing facility for large defense consortiums.

Name: The Dark
Flavour Text: A massive nebula dominating the skies of many core worlds. Thick clouds of dust obscure its heart, a lightless refuge where Empyrean ships have congregated for millennia.

Name: Thibah
Flavour Text: Burdened by overpopulation and low mineral content in the planetary crust. Historically used as a staging world for deep-space exploration and trade.

Name: Torkan
Flavour Text: Populous planet almost completely dependent on foreign imports to sustain the extravagant lifestyles of its citizens.

Name: Tren'lak
Flavour Text: Icy and desolate. Other than the ferocious snow dracs and the rare icemoon flowers, life is restricted to the N'orr boomtowers and ice mines.

Name: Valk
Flavour Text: Valk contains lodes of rare minerals and metals within its crust. Skyhooks bring ore shipments up from the surface to the open-air shipyards in orbit.

Name: Vefut II
Flavour Text: Massive, rocky world cursed with extreme gravity. Underground cities support advanced research in antigravity technologies.

Name: Vega Major
Flavour Text: Most of the population resides in orbital habitats supporting mining operations in the planetary ring. Surface colonization limited due to oceanic macrosquid infestations.

Name: Vega Minor
Flavour Text: Famous for extremely shallow seas covering most of the surface and for the renowned Vega Propulsion Corporation. Stilt cities host vibrant multi-species populations.

Name: Velnor
Flavour Text: Barren world of windswept rocks and thick, murky oceans. Lack of local lifeforms allows corporations to strip-mine the surface and test orbital kinetic weapons at the poles.

Name: Vorhal
Flavour Text: This icy world is wreathed by powerful storms, forcing inhabitants to live underground in geothermal vents. Pacifistic locals award yearly "peace prizes" to peacemakers across the galaxy.

Name: Wellon
Flavour Text: Sky cities suspended in helium-rich atmosphere more noted for fantastic views than the small quantities of exotic elements harvested by their chemical mines.

Name: Winnu
Flavour Text: The shining cities of the Winnu are the last places where authentic Lazax art and culture are still revered.

Name: Wren Terra
Flavour Text: Arid, windy, and populated primarily by predatory Daartar hounds. The Barony utilizes large swaths of its northern steppes for low-yield agriculture.

Name: Xanhact
Flavour Text: Rebelled during the end of the Lazax Empire, and was bombarded to ash by a Lazax fleet as an example. Left by the Galactic Council as a memorial to Lazax tyranny.

Name: Xxehan
Flavour Text: Known for genetically complex native lifeforms adapted to tainted atmosphere and toxic biochemistry.

Name: Ylir
Flavour Text: The smallest of the three planets in the Atharal Torus, Ylir is covered in kilometers of water. The Murmeration meets in platform cities that drift with the currents.

Name: Zohbat
Flavour Text: Known for its highly intoxicating Zohlian whiskey and the planetary space elevator that links the surface with orbital stations and shipyards.
